sn45.16:1.2: “Mendicants, these eight things don’t arise to be purified, bright, flawless, and rid of corruptions except when a Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha has appeared.
sn45.16:1.4: They are: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
sn45.16:1.5: These eight things don’t arise to be purified, bright, flawless, and rid of corruptions except when a Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha has appeared.”
